Expectation1: Respond to emails and messages within a reasonable time frame
Situation1: The team awaits a clarification before progressing with a shared task.
Expectation2: Follow safety and hygiene protocols at all times.
Situation2: They wear gloves occasionally when handling certain cleaning tasks.
Story: I sat at my desk, the hum of the office blending with the distant sound of a vacuum. My phone buzzed again—another message from my team, waiting for my input on the project. I knew they couldn’t move forward until I clarified the next steps. I glanced at the clock, feeling the pressure mount. But my shift as the housekeeping cleaner was about to start, and I was already running late. I hurried to the supply closet, pulling on my uniform and grabbing the gloves. The manager had been strict lately about safety and hygiene, especially after last week’s inspection. I was supposed to wear gloves for every cleaning task, no exceptions. But my phone kept vibrating in my pocket, each buzz a reminder of my colleagues’ expectations. I stood in the hallway, gloves in hand, torn between the urgent emails and the strict cleaning protocols. My mind raced, weighing the demands of both roles, feeling the tension tighten in my chest as I tried to decide what to do next.
